message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from the United Arab Emirates. I need to provide my level of agreement with each of the 10 statements using the response options: "Strongly disagree", "Disagree", "Agree", "Strongly agree", or "I don't know".

Let me think through each statement from the perspective of a teacher in UAE:

TT4G35A: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - I would say "Agree" because AI tools can indeed assist in generating and refining lesson plans.

TT4G35B: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - I would say "Agree" because AI can personalize content and adapt to different learning levels.

TT4G35C: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - I would say "Agree" because AI can provide personalized feedback and support.

TT4G35D: AI supports students with specific needs (e.g., multilingual learners, students with special education needs) - I would say "Agree" because AI can help with translation, accessibility, and individualized support.

TT4G35E: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - I would say "Strongly agree" because this is one of the clearest benefits of AI in education.

TT4G35F: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - I would say "Agree" because this is a real concern with AI tools like ChatGPT that can generate text that students could submit as their own.

TT4G35G: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - I would say "Agree" because AI systems can make errors and produce incorrect information.

TT4G35H: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - I would say "Agree" because this is a documented concern with AI systems trained on biased data.

TT4G35I: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - I would say "Agree" because there are legitimate concerns about data privacy with AI systems.
 
TT4G35J: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - I would say "Agree" because while AI can offer useful suggestions, it doesn't always understand the nuances of effective teaching methods and may recommend approaches that don't align with sound educational practice. I'm trying to give responses that reflect both the genuine advantages AI offers in education while also acknowledging the real risks and limitations that educators need to be aware of.
